chunk_text: Effective Date: 27th June 2025 WHAT YOU’RE COVERED FOR All benefits are per policy year unless otherwise stated. For full terms and conditions, read your Policy Document. Table of Cover - Level Health Plan A Your Hospital Cover Your hospital cover means the amount we pay the hospital directly for the bed that you are in while in hospital. It includes Public Hospitals cover for in-patient (overnight stay) treatments and day case Day case Full cover (admitted and discharged on the same day) services. Semi-private room Full cover Covered at semi-private rate means that if you choose accommodation in a private room, we will cover up to the Private room Covered at semi-private rate rate of a semi-private room and you pay the rest. A full list of all approved hospitals can be found here. Hospital Cover - Other Benefits Consultants' fees Full cover for participating consultants Covered up to 100 days per calendar year (with any insurer) - Public hospitals Psychiatric treatment only Drug, alcohol, gambling & substance abuse Covered up to 91 days every 5 years (with any insurer) - Public facilities only Convalescence care €26 per day for up to 14 days QuickClaims This icon means you can claim this benefit using our QuickClaims service. Maternity Benefits Simply pay your healthcare provider, take a picture of your receipt, and Maternity in-patient hospital delivery Up to €400 per claim submit it through QuickClaims on the Level Health app to get your refund. In-patient maternity consultant fees Up to €400 per claim 1 TABLE_ROW: Your Hospital Cover | TABLE_ROW: Public Hospitals | TABLE_ROW: Day case | Full cover TABLE_ROW: Semi-private room | Full cover TABLE_ROW: Private room | Covered at semi-private rate TABLE_ROW: Hospital Cover - Other Benefits | TABLE_ROW: Consultants' fees | Full cover for participating consultants TABLE_ROW: Psychiatric treatment | Covered up to 100 days per calendar year (with any insurer) - Public hospitals only TABLE_ROW: Drug, alcohol, gambling & substance abuse Convalescence care | Covered up to 91 days every 5 years (with any insurer) - Public facilities only €26 per day for up to 14 days TABLE_ROW: Maternity Benefits | TABLE_ROW: Maternity in-patient hospital delivery | Up to €400 per claim TABLE_ROW: In-patient maternity consultant fees | Up to €400 per claim

International Cover This section explains cover outside of Ireland. That includes Up to €100,000 per annum (must be arranged by calling International International emergency hospital admission emergency hospital treatment that arises when you are on Assist Line) a temporary stay outside Ireland. It includes cover for Repatriation Up to €1,000,000 (must be arranged by calling International Assist Line) repatriation expenses and companion expenses. Companion expenses including repatriation Up to €1,000 Urgent care abroad Up to €100 per visit You can claim back the cost of attending an approved Urgent Care or Minor Injury Unit, or an Emergency Urgent Care Department in a Private Hospital. Minor Injury and Urgent Public A&E Up to €100 per visit Care Clinics are walk-in medical clinics for treatments of broken bones, sprains, strains and other minor illnesses. Urgent Care Clinics & Minor Injury Units Up to €100 per visit in approved centres A full list of all available Urgent Care Clinics, Minor Injury Emergency Departments in Private Hospitals Up to €100 per visit in approved centres Units, and Emergency Departments in Private Hospitals can be found here. Scans MRI, CT and PET-CT scans (in approved facilities) Full cover MRI, CT and PET-CT scans (in non-approved facilities) Covered up to €150 Dexa scan Full cover in approved facilities A full list of all approved scan centres can be found here. Mammogram (in approved facilities) Full cover Mammogram (in non-approved facilities) Covered up to €100 Ultrasound Covered up to €100 NEED HELP ABROAD? Call our International Assist line on +353 1 602 7004 2 TABLE_ROW: International Cover | TABLE_ROW: International emergency hospital admission | Up to €100,000 per annum (must be arranged by calling International Assist Line) TABLE_ROW: Repatriation | Up to €1,000,000 (must be arranged by calling International Assist Line) TABLE_ROW: Companion expenses including repatriation | Up to €1,000 TABLE_ROW: Urgent care abroad | Up to €100 per visit TABLE_ROW: Urgent Care | TABLE_ROW: Public A&E | Up to €100 per visit TABLE_ROW: Urgent Care Clinics & Minor Injury Units | Up to €100 per visit in approved centres TABLE_ROW: Emergency Departments in Private Hospitals | Up to €100 per visit in approved centres TABLE_ROW: Scans | TABLE_ROW: MRI, CT and PET-CT scans (in approved facilities) | Full cover TABLE_ROW: MRI, CT and PET-CT scans (in non-approved facilities) | Covered up to €150 TABLE_ROW: Dexa scan | Full cover in approved facilities TABLE_ROW: Mammogram (in approved facilities) | Full cover TABLE_ROW: Mammogram (in non-approved facilities) | Covered up to €100 TABLE_ROW: Ultrasound | Covered up to €100

Telemedicine Service - QuickClinic (Click here for latest range of telemedicine benefits) QuickClinic WhatsApp or message an Irish based Doctor - 24/7 on-demand Unlimited Skip the waiting rooms and get WhatsApp or message a Midwife Unlimited immediate medical advice from qualified doctors, midwives and WhatsApp or message a Mental Health Professional Unlimited mental health professionals. Video calls with an Irish based Doctor - 24/7 on-demand Unlimited Whether you need a prescription refill, have a health concern, or Video calls with a Mental Health Professional Unlimited need professional reassurance, our doctors are available 24/7, in your Video calls with a Physiotherapist Unlimited pocket. Video calls with a Nutritionist Unlimited These services can be accessed Online Prescription Service Unlimited through the Level Health app and on the website. Mental Health Assessment Unlimited Expert Medical Opinion Unlimited Day to Day Medical Expenses Your plan includes cashback for face-to-face visits for a range of everyday health expenses. These are consultations GP visits €30 per visit, 1 visit per annum that generally take place outside of a hospital setting. You can claim for these through QuickClaims on the Level Physiotherapist visits €30 per visit, 1 visit per annum Health app. Psychotherapy and Counselling €30 per visit, 1 visit per annum 3 TABLE_ROW: Telemedicine Service - QuickClinic (Click here for latest range of telemedicine benefits) | TABLE_ROW: WhatsApp or message an Irish based Doctor - 24/7 on-demand | Unlimited TABLE_ROW: WhatsApp or message a Midwife | Unlimited TABLE_ROW: WhatsApp or message a Mental Health Professional | Unlimited TABLE_ROW: Video calls with an Irish based Doctor - 24/7 on-demand | Unlimited TABLE_ROW: Video calls with a Mental Health Professional | Unlimited TABLE_ROW: Video calls with a Physiotherapist | Unlimited TABLE_ROW: Video calls with a Nutritionist | Unlimited TABLE_ROW: Online Prescription Service | Unlimited TABLE_ROW: Mental Health Assessment | Unlimited TABLE_ROW: Expert Medical Opinion | Unlimited TABLE_ROW: Day to Day Medical Expenses | TABLE_ROW: GP visits | €30 per visit, 1 visit per annum TABLE_ROW: Physiotherapist visits | €30 per visit, 1 visit per annum TABLE_ROW: Psychotherapy and Counselling | €30 per visit, 1 visit per annum

Out-patient Cover (subject to excess) The out-patient excess is the annual amount you must pay out-of-pocket for out-patient treatment before your Excess per person €125 insurance benefits begin to apply. Consultant fees €50 per visit The claim amount listed for each out-patient benefit is the Emergency Dental Benefit Up to €250 per claim amount that contributes towards reaching the out-patient excess. This means that if you had an out-patient consultant Pathology diagnostic test Up to €20 per test visit that cost you €200, €50 of that visit would apply towards the out-patient excess amount. Pathologist fees Up to €25 per test Radiology diagnostic test Up to €20 per test Radiologist fees Up to €25 per test Overall limit on Day to Day and Out-patient benefits €2,500 4 TABLE_ROW: Out-patient Cover (subject to excess) | TABLE_ROW: Excess per person | €125 TABLE_ROW: Consultant fees | €50 per visit TABLE_ROW: Emergency Dental Benefit | Up to €250 per claim TABLE_ROW: Pathology diagnostic test | Up to €20 per test TABLE_ROW: Pathologist fees | Up to €25 per test TABLE_ROW: Radiology diagnostic test | Up to €20 per test TABLE_ROW: Radiologist fees | Up to €25 per test TABLE_ROW: Overall limit on Day to Day and Out-patient benefits | €2,500

Effective Date: 27th June 2025 WHAT YOU’RE COVERED FOR All benefits are per policy year unless otherwise stated. For full terms and conditions, read your Policy Document. Table of Cover - Level Health Plan B (with €150 Excess) Your Hospital Cover Your hospital cover means the amount we pay the hospital directly for the bed that you are in while in hospital. It includes Public Hospitals cover for in-patient (overnight stay) treatments and day case Day case Full cover (admitted and discharged on the same day) services. Semi-private room Full cover Covered at semi-private rate means that if you choose accommodation in a private room, we will cover up to the Private room Covered at semi-private rate rate of a semi-private room and you pay the rest. Private Hospitals A full list of all approved hospitals can be found here. Day case Covered with a €100 excess per claim Semi-private room Covered with a €150 excess per admission Private room Covered at semi-private rate with €150 excess per admission Specified orthopaedic procedures Co-payment of €2,000 (in addition to excess) QuickClaims Specified ophthalmic procedures Co-payment of €400 (in addition to excess) This icon means you can claim this benefit using our QuickClaims Hospital Cover - Other Benefits service. Simply pay your healthcare provider, take a picture of your Consultants' fees Full cover for participating consultants receipt, and submit it through Psychiatric treatment Covered up to 100 days per calendar year (with any insurer), subject to excess QuickClaims on the Level Health app to get your refund. Drug, alcohol, gambling & substance abuse Covered up to 91 days every 5 years (with any insurer), subject to excess Convalescence care €26 per day for up to 14 days 1 TABLE_ROW: Your Hospital Cover | TABLE_ROW: Public Hospitals | TABLE_ROW: Day case | Full cover TABLE_ROW: Semi-private room | Full cover TABLE_ROW: Private room | Covered at semi-private rate TABLE_ROW: Private Hospitals | TABLE_ROW: Day case | Covered with a €100 excess per claim TABLE_ROW: Semi-private room | Covered with a €150 excess per admission TABLE_ROW: Private room | Covered at semi-private rate with €150 excess per admission TABLE_ROW: Specified orthopaedic procedures | Co-payment of €2,000 (in addition to excess) TABLE_ROW: Specified ophthalmic procedures | Co-payment of €400 (in addition to excess) TABLE_ROW: | | TABLE_ROW: Hospital Cover - Other Benefits | TABLE_ROW: Consultants' fees | Full cover for participating consultants TABLE_ROW: Psychiatric treatment | Covered up to 100 days per calendar year (with any insurer), subject to excess TABLE_ROW: Drug, alcohol, gambling & substance abuse | Covered up to 91 days every 5 years (with any insurer), subject to excess TABLE_ROW: Convalescence care | €26 per day for up to 14 days

You are covered for maternity care at any listed public Maternity Benefits hospital. There are no private maternity hospitals in Ireland. Maternity in-patient hospital delivery Full cover up to 3 nights If you choose to be a private patient in a public hospital, you will be covered for up to 3 nights. If your hospital stay In-patient maternity consultant fees Full cover for participating consultants is less than 3 nights, you may be able to claim for eligible Up to €800 for eligible expenses per pregnancy if home after 1 night expenses under the post-natal home support benefit. Post-natal home support (if hospital stay is less than 3 nights) in hospital, or up to €400 if home after 2 nights in hospital If your delivery is by caesarean section, your hospital stay Pre-natal care Up to €250 for eligible expenses per pregnancy will be covered under your in-patient hospital cover. Post-natal care Up to €250 for eligible expenses per pregnancy Your private health insurance provides contributions towards in-patient consultant delivery fees, covering Cash Support Benefits (per policy year) the obstetrician, anaesthetist and paediatrician. Cardiac hospitalisation support benefit Up to €250 for eligible expenses NEED HELP ABROAD? Cancer support benefit Up to €250 for eligible expenses Call our International Assist line Child hospitalisation support benefit Up to €250 for eligible expenses on +353 1 602 7004 Fertility support benefit Up to €250 for eligible expenses This section explains cover outside of Ireland. That includes International Cover emergency hospital treatment that arises when you are on a temporary stay outside Ireland. It includes cover Up to €100,000 per annum (must be arranged by calling International International emergency hospital admission Assist Line) for repatriation expenses and companion expenses. It also includes elective cover in hospitals outside Ireland Repatriation Up to €1,000,000 (must be arranged by calling International Assist Line) for which you may be able to make a claim. For elective Companion expenses including repatriation Up to €1,000 treatment outside Ireland, we cover up to the same amount that the treatment would cost in Ireland, up to Urgent care abroad Up to €200 per visit a maximum of €100,000. Elective treatment outside Ireland Covered up to €100,000, subject to pre-approval You can claim back the cost of attending an approved Urgent Care Urgent Care Clinic or Minor Injury Unit, or an Emergency Department in a Private Hospital. Minor injury and urgent Public A&E Up to €100 per visit care clinics are walk-in medical clinics for treatments of broken bones, sprains, strains and other minor illnesses. Urgent Care Clinics & Minor Injury Units Up to €200 per visit in approved centres A full list of all available Urgent Care Clinics, Minor Emergency Departments in Private Hospitals Up to €200 per visit in approved centres Injury Units, and Emergency Departments in Private Hospitals can be found here. 2 TABLE_ROW: Maternity Benefits | TABLE_ROW: Maternity in-patient hospital delivery | Full cover up to 3 nights TABLE_ROW: In-patient maternity consultant fees | Full cover for participating consultants TABLE_ROW: Post-natal home support (if hospital stay is less than 3 nights) | Up to €800 for eligible expenses per pregnancy if home after 1 night in hospital, or up to €400 if home after 2 nights in hospital TABLE_ROW: Pre-natal care | Up to €250 for eligible expenses per pregnancy TABLE_ROW: Post-natal care | Up to €250 for eligible expenses per pregnancy TABLE_ROW: Cash Support Benefits (per policy year) | TABLE_ROW: Cardiac hospitalisation support benefit | Up to €250 for eligible expenses TABLE_ROW: Cancer support benefit | Up to €250 for eligible expenses TABLE_ROW: Child hospitalisation support benefit | Up to €250 for eligible expenses TABLE_ROW: Fertility support benefit | Up to €250 for eligible expenses TABLE_ROW: International Cover | TABLE_ROW: International emergency hospital admission | Up to €100,000 per annum (must be arranged by calling International Assist Line) TABLE_ROW: Repatriation | Up to €1,000,000 (must be arranged by calling International Assist Line) TABLE_ROW: Companion expenses including repatriation | Up to €1,000 TABLE_ROW: Urgent care abroad | Up to €200 per visit TABLE_ROW: Elective treatment outside Ireland | Covered up to €100,000, subject to pre-approval TABLE_ROW: Urgent Care | TABLE_ROW: Public A&E | Up to €100 per visit TABLE_ROW: Urgent Care Clinics & Minor Injury Units | Up to €200 per visit in approved centres TABLE_ROW: Emergency Departments in Private Hospitals | Up to €200 per visit in approved centres

Effective Date: 27th June 2025 WHAT YOU’RE COVERED FOR All benefits are per policy year unless otherwise stated. For full terms and conditions, read your Policy Document. Table of Cover - Level Health Plan C Your Hospital Cover Your hospital cover means the amount we pay the hospital directly for the bed that you are in while in hospital. It includes Public Hospitals cover for in-patient (overnight stay) treatments and day case Day case Full cover (admitted and discharged on the same day) services. Semi-private room Full cover Covered at semi-private rate means that if you choose accommodation in a private room, we will cover up to the Private room Full cover rate of a semi-private room and you pay the rest. Private Hospitals A full list of all approved hospitals can be found here. Hospital Cover - Other Benefits Consultants' fees Full cover for participating consultants Psychiatric treatment Covered up to 100 days per calendar year (with any insurer), subject to excess Drug, alcohol, gambling & substance abuse Covered up to 91 days every 5 years (with any insurer), subject to excess Convalescence care €26 per day for up to 14 days You are covered for maternity care at any listed public Maternity Benefits hospital. There are no private maternity hospitals in Ireland. Maternity in-patient hospital delivery Full cover up to 3 nights If you choose to be a private patient in a public hospital, you will be covered for up to 3 nights. If your hospital stay In-patient maternity consultant fees Full cover for participating consultants is less than 3 nights, you may be able to claim for eligible Up to €800 for eligible expenses per pregnancy if home after 1 night expenses under the post-natal home support benefit. Post-natal home support (if hospital stay is less than 3 nights) in hospital, or up to €400 if home after 2 nights in hospital If your delivery is by caesarean section, your hospital stay Pre-natal care Up to €250 for eligible expenses per pregnancy will be covered under your in-patient hospital cover. Post-natal care Up to €250 for eligible expenses per pregnancy Your private health insurance provides contributions towards in-patient consultant delivery fees, covering Cash Support Benefits (per policy year) the obstetrician, anaesthetist and paediatrician. Cardiac hospitalisation support benefit Up to €250 for eligible expenses Cancer support benefit Up to €250 for eligible expenses NEED HELP ABROAD? Child hospitalisation support benefit Up to €250 for eligible expenses Call our International Assist line on +353 1 602 7004 Fertility support benefit Up to €250 for eligible expenses International Cover This section explains cover outside of Ireland. That includes Up to €100,000 per annum (must be arranged by calling International emergency hospital treatment that arises when you are International emergency hospital admission Assist Line) on a temporary stay outside Ireland. It includes cover for Repatriation Up to €1,000,000 (must be arranged by calling International Assist Line) repatriation expenses and companion expenses. It also includes elective cover in hospitals outside Ireland for Companion expenses including repatriation Up to €1,000 which you may be able to make a claim. For elective treatment outside Ireland, we cover up to the same Urgent care abroad Up to €250 per visit amount that the treatment would cost in Ireland, up to a maximum of €100,000. Day to Day Medical Expenses Your plan includes cashback for face-to-face visits for a range of everyday health expenses. These are consultations GP visits €40 per visit, 1 visit per annum that generally take place outside of a hospital setting. You Physiotherapist visits €40 per visit, 1 visit per annum can claim for these through QuickClaims on the Level Health app. Psychotherapy and Counselling €40 per visit, 1 visit per annum Out-patient Cover (subject to excess) Excess €125 Consultant fees €50 per visit Emergency Dental Benefit Up to €250 per claim The out-patient excess is the annual amount you must pay out-of-pocket for out-patient treatment before your Pathology diagnostic test Up to €20 per test insurance benefits begin to apply. Pathologist fees Up to €25 per test The claim amount listed for each out-patient benefit is the Radiology diagnostic test Up to €20 per test amount that contributes towards reaching the out-patient excess. This means that if you had an out-patient consultant Radiologist fees Up to €25 per test visit that cost you €200, €50 of that visit would apply towards the out-patient excess amount. You Consultant visits €150 per visit, 2 visits per annum can claim for these through QuickClaims on the Level Health app. Dentist visits (routine treatment) €50 per visit, 6 visits per annum Pooling applies to Day to Day medical expenses, meaning Physiotherapist visits €50 per visit, 6 visits per annum you can share visits with other members on the same policy and plan. Psychotherapy and Counselling €50 per visit, 6 visits per annum The benefit for Complementary Therapists covers the Complementary Therapists (Acupuncture, Chiropody, Chiropractor, Dietician, Massage Therapist, Nutritionist, Occupational Therapist, number of visit(s) you can claim for in total across all of the €50 per visit, 6 visits per annum Optometrist, Osteopathy, Physical Therapy, Podiatrist, Reflexology, listed practitioners, not a number of visits for each type Reiki, Speech and Language Therapist) of practitioner. Health screen €100 x 1 per annum Radiology diagnostic test Up to €20 per test Radiologist fees Up to €25 per test The out-patient excess is the annual amount you must pay out-of-pocket for out-patient treatment before your Out-patient Cover (subject to excess) insurance benefits begin to apply. Excess per person €125 The claim amount listed for each out-patient benefit is the amount that contributes towards reaching the out-patient Consultant fees €50 per visit excess. This means that if you had an out-patient consultant Emergency Dental Benefit Up to €250 per claim visit that cost you €200, €50 of that visit would apply towards the out-patient excess amount.
